title.narrative: FFF Fair Tax Monitor Sida Senegal CO

description.narrative:
The goal of this program is to ensure that citizens are empowered to redress inequality of power and influence, so fiscal systems are more progressive, and governments implement tax and spending policies that benefit the many, not the few. Active citizenship is therefore an essential element.
Within this framework, our intervention in Senegal will focus on implementing the Fair Tax Monitor research.
The FTM is an evidence-based advocacy tool that identifies the main bottlenecks within tax systems and provides strong evidence for advocacy work at national and international level. The tool allows for a comparison of tax policies and practices in different countries, using a standardized methodology and unified research approach thanks to a jointly developed common research framework.
This framework can be used to analyze national tax systems at six different levels, tax progressiveness, revenue sufficiency, effectiveness of tax administration, pro-poor public spending, accountability and tax exemptions.
Participating country teams will take part in the revision of the common research framework and scoring methodology, based on the lessons from the pilot phase. The support will be given by staff from Oxfam Novib in The Hague and Tax Justice Network - Africa in Nairobi. The countries will be supported to implement research and to develop influencing strategies based on the research.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam is working in Senegal since 1981 and has opened a first office in Senegal in 1983. Oxfam in Senegal is implementing a 5-year country strategy (2015-2019) which is articulated around the following vision which is:
Senegal has an active citizenry,comprising of a good representation of men, women and youth, that is willing and capable of influencing the development and implementation of national policies, and receives a more equitable share of the national wealth.
The country strategy uses a two-tiered approach: - to promote citizen participation in policy formulation and implementation processes; - To promote innovativefield programming that addresses the immediate needs of the poorest segments of society while strengthening their capacity to influence local authorities.
This strategy focusses on sustainable livelihoods, promoting good governance and humanitarian (contributingto strengthening the leadership of local actors in the context of integrated disaster management, from prevention to emergency response). It also recognizes the under-utilized potentialities and power of some marginalized groups, especially women and youth.
Oxfam in Senegal adheres to six partnership principles: shared vision and values,mutual accountability, complementarity, clarity of roles, institutional autonomy, and commitment to joint learning, and is carrying out projects through partnering with local NGOs and organisations (such as producer#s organisations).
